title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:19  has quit 00:25  has joined #xwiki 01:34  has quit 02:35  has quit 03:40  has joined #xwiki 03:41  has quit 05:30  has quit 06:45  has quit 07:37  has quit 07:43  has joined #xwiki 07:50  has joined #xwiki 08:30  has quit 08:44  has joined #xwiki 08:52  has joined #xwiki 08:53  has quit 09:26  has joined #xwiki 09:37  has joined #xwiki 09:40  has joined #xwiki 09:50  vmassol: do you remember if the XHTML table renderer was changed during 2.x cycle? I have the impression that the table headings were generated inside a thead element but now I see that they are inside tbody. This fixes one of my issues XWIKI-4533 but I'm interested in what made you change the renderer. 09:51  mflorea1: hmm I don't know but I remember Thomas modified it at some point 09:51  to support headers as columns and as lines I think 09:52  (but not sure it's related to what you mention) 09:53  I see         getXHTMLWikiPrinter().printXMLStartElement("th", parametersWithScope); 09:53  in beginTableHeadCell() 09:54  i don't see any tbody 09:54  (in XHTMLChainingRenderer) 09:55  hmm, I double checked and the thead is generated by the editor. So, when you insert the table from wiki syntax and switch to WYSIWYG the row with TH cells is inside TBODY, but if you insert a table from the WYSIWYG editor, the row with TH cells is inside THEAD element 09:56  I doubt that the tbody is coming from the rendering 09:56  unless it's the cleaner 09:57  (which is outside the rendering) 09:57  indeed, the WYSIWYG editor input is:
FooBar
12
09:57  the TBODY is added by the browser when building the DOM tree 10:00  I should change the WYSIWYG editor to generate the same thing when inserting a table from the editor 10:00  well we could change the renderer too if the browser's version is more correct 10:00  we need to decide which version we want 10:01  well, I looked at the DTD and tr inside table is valid 10:01   10:01  so the rendering generates valid XHTML 10:01  has joined #xwiki 10:04  has quit 10:05  has quit 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:06  has quit 10:06  has joined #xwiki 10:07  has joined #xwiki 10:10  has quit 10:19  has joined #xwiki 10:34  has joined #xwiki 11:01 <+Denis> hi devs, in XWiki 2.4, while using action 'get' and 'outputSyntax=plain', we have an issue that breaks our JSON due to removal of XWiki syntax in the rendered content. Is that expected ? have I missed something ? 11:01 <+Denis> for example, '\_\_' or '\*\*' are removed 11:05  has joined #xwiki 11:05  nice hudson… oops Jenkin dashboard: https://ci.exoplatform.org/ 11:05  hello everyone 11:08  has joined #xwiki 11:47  has quit 12:27  has quit 12:35  hey, i got a goodie for you 12:38  http://pastebin.com/DpFcH1js 12:38  for Filterable Sortable table here 12:38  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HTables 12:39  the pastebin'ed code allows you to use standard XWiki markup 2.0 to make such a list 12:44  jstoldt: thanks I'll update that + point to the livetable link 12:45  livetable link? you mean the livetable macro and so forth? 12:49  another question that you hopefully can answer, is there a way to "pre-enter" a filter when calling the page with a special link? 12:49  like: /bin/view/Glossary/List?val=a and only entries with a are shown 12:53  has quit 12:55  jstoldt: yes you can! For ex: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.name&d=asc&type=plugin 12:56  has joined #xwiki 13:01  are there docs on this? i am a little confused, i'm afraid... 13:02  no doc right now 13:03  |t is the table id 13:03  d is the order 13:03  type is the field name 13:03  i see 13:03  p is the page 13:04  let me see if i can make anything of this 13:04  l is how many entries to display 13:04  s is the sort column 13:04  just copy paste te URL you get 13:04  when you use the livetable 13:04  it's a simple as that 13:04  you don't need to know anything in practice 13:05  just do the fitlering/search you want in the livetable and copy paste the URL 13:05  well, i am not exactly using livetable 13:05  this is for the livetable 13:05  if you're not usinf the livetable forget it it's not going to do anything 13:05  i am using the filterable, sortable table i pastebin'ed above 13:05  ok then you're on your own 13:05  :) 13:05  lucky me! ;) 13:06  this has been deprecated and removed a while ago btw 13:06  replaced by livetable 13:06  it was the old way of doing things 13:06  well, that is all well and nice but i think it's the best way to do it here 13:07  so i can enable employees to do it all on one page 13:07  while still having sort and filter available 13:07  without creating extra classes and without having to maintain a new page for each entry of the list 13:08  this is just a dictionairy, so it's not worth the effort of creating classes and thousands of pages 13:10  has joined #xwiki 13:10  has quit 13:14  has joined #xwiki 13:18  jstoldt: if you can guarantee that the data is contrained in number it's fine 13:18  has joined #xwiki 13:18  (the issue is performance if you have lots of data to display on one page) 13:19  well, right now i am using one list per letter of the alphabet 13:19  but i was thinking about uniting it to one link and use preconfigured links that will auto-filter 13:19  but it's only two columns and a couple of hundred cells in total, i think 13:20  yeah, i think in total it would be around 1000 rows in total if i were to combine all lists 13:54  jstoldt: done in XE-813 13:55  and did XE-814 at the same time.... 13:55  thanks 13:55  you're welcome :Ö) 13:56  shouldn't the second link point to the livetable 2.0 macro? 13:56  no 13:56  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro+2.0 13:56  that macro doesn't exist yet 13:57  this is a macro contributed by a user 13:57  not done by the xwiki dev team and not supported 13:57  as indicated 13:57  O\_o Developed by Ludovic Dubost (XWiki SAS 13:57  yes 13:58  but yeah, i see it's not included 13:58  still, might be worth refactoring the macro and including it in XWiki to push the use of 2.0 syntax over 1.0 syntax. 13:59  http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4390 13:59  "so you got it all figured out" \*Chris Griffen voice\* 14:00  yeah since september 09 14:00  only thing we haven't figured out is who's going to do it 14:00  :) 14:00  obviously the answer to that question is "somebody else" :-D 14:01  anyway, if ldubost already contributed it to the extensions wiki, why doesn't he refactor it and pushes it to trunk? 14:01  ahah… because doing a little poc is about 1 hour of work… doing it properly is about 4-5 days of work 14:02  and it requires communication 14:02  fair enough. didn't think it would be this bad... much to learn i have, about the mysteries of professional development :) 14:02  it's important the devs agree about it since they're going to support it forever thereafter 14:02  very true 14:03  fyi Asiri started the design work here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/LiveTable20Macro 14:03  i see 14:03  but the discussion wasn't started about it 14:03  okay 14:03  so nothing has been agreed yet 14:03  then he left the project 14:03  so someone else need to volunteer to continue the work and push it 14:04  ie make a proposal 14:04  has joined #xwiki 14:04  pitty... i actually considered about joining the coding but then i figured learning java from scratch might take so much time it wouldn't be worth it with my limited time 14:04  jstoldt: you could start by proposing a design for the livetable macro! 14:05  :) 14:06  which, i reckon, would require me to know about the structure of the code and the usual requirements for a design proposal... both of which i lack 14:06  sorry 14:12  has joined #xwiki 14:13  has joined #xwiki 14:16  has joined #xwiki 14:18  has quit 14:38 <+mflorea> vmassol: I noticed that this code: 14:38 <+mflorea> (% param="value" %) 14:38 <+mflorea> {{blockMacro/}} 14:38 <+mflorea> doesn't work, i.e. the macro is not rendered because the context is considered to be in-line. Is this done on purpose? 14:38  that's normal I think (not 100% sure). Can you try: 14:39  ah no 14:39  was going to say: 14:39  (% param="value" %){{blockMacro/}} 14:39  but it should work with a NL I think 14:39  thomas worked on this 14:39  so I'm not an expert, I'd need to check the code 14:39 <+mflorea> still in-line, I have a NL before and after 14:40  let me dig a bit 14:40 <+mflorea> ok, np 14:44  has quit 14:47  has quit 14:53  has joined #xwiki 14:53  back, had internet loss 14:53  mflorea: not sure what you saw of what I posted 14:54 <+mflorea> nothing :( 14:54  bad news is that we don't seem to have an integration tests for this 14:54  2:45 14:54  still checking 14:54  2:46 14:54  found XWIKI-5046 14:54  2:46 14:54  come on bot! 14:54  2:47 14:54  http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5046 14:54  sorry bot it wasn't you, you were good 14:54 <+mflorea> :) 14:55 <+mflorea> I know XWIKI-5046, but it's not related. The problem is not with parsing but with rendering. When rendering. 14:55 <+mflorea> well, I'm not sure it's a problem 14:56  still looking I remember creating a jira issue for adding support for macro params 14:56 <+mflorea> I just noticed that you can't add parameters to the container of a block macro 14:56 <+mflorea> but maybe that's the intended behavior 14:56  http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3237 14:56  it's still open 14:57 <+mflorea> exactly 14:57 <+mflorea> ok 14:57 <+mflorea> that's it, thanks! 15:05 <@sdumitriu> Who wants new administration icons? https://fundry.com/feature/94-new-icons-for-the-administration-sections 15:07  sdumitriu: so you're giving 10$ for someone to design new icons, is that it? 15:07 <@sdumitriu> Yes 15:07 <@sdumitriu> Actually I'm trying it out with Ciprian to see how this works 15:07  ok 15:11 <+sburjan> mobody will do it for 10$ 15:11 <+sburjan> \*nobody 15:11  but people will do it for 0$ 15:12  I don't agree sburjan that nobody will do it for 0$ 15:12 <+sburjan> this sounds like freelancing 15:12  10$ is about 100 euros in France for some countries and that's not bad 15:13  it all depnd on how complex it is 15:13  to get the money 15:13 <@sdumitriu> Hey, I'm not actually trying to pay someone to do that 15:13  that seems the hard part to me 15:13 <@sdumitriu> Just trying to see what's the process 15:13 <+sburjan> i know.. but a talented designer will not do it for 10$ no matter how chinese it is.  At least not something better than what we have now 15:13 <@sdumitriu> It seems it's using PayPal 15:14 <+sburjan> maybe it's a big fan of XWiki 15:14 <+sburjan> \*if 15:14 <@cjdelisle> people do stuff for free, look at wikipedia 15:15 <+sburjan> ok. we'll see 15:18  has joined #xwiki 15:20  has joined #xwiki 15:20 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I have a question. I am running M1 and I am in Admin Zone -> Users. I click on the pen in order to edit a user, but I have no option to change it's password. I am logged in as Admin. Am I missing something, or the option have been taken out from there ? 15:26 <+sburjan> I mean it's not in the modal anymore 15:27 <@sdumitriu> Was it there? 15:27 <@sdumitriu> Ah, it was moved 15:27 <+sburjan> okay 15:27 <+sburjan> just wanted to make sure 15:34 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: If 10$ is not enough, feel free to add more 15:35 <+sburjan> I have freelance friends, and usually onle one logo costs 30+ USD 15:35 <+sburjan> from sites like rentacoder or oDesk, which are known to pay under the medium 15:35 <+sburjan> average costs 15:36  has joined #xwiki 15:36 <@sdumitriu> The goal of Fundry is for people to add their two cents until the sum is big enough for someone to be willing to do it 15:36 <@sdumitriu> Or until someone really needs that done and does it, and he gets a little extra on top 15:36  has quit 15:38  has joined #xwiki 15:39 <+evalica> sdumitriu: the money are already taken from your account when you create the feature task? or it waits for the completion of the task and then deduct it ? 15:39 <@sdumitriu> I can retract my pledge if I want 15:40 <@sdumitriu> Well, it's not direct payment 15:40  has quit 15:40 <@sdumitriu> I transfer some money to my Fundry account 15:40 <@sdumitriu> And then I pledge from my Fundry wallet 15:40 <@sdumitriu> So the money is taken when I put it on Fundry 15:41 <+evalica> I want to know when you make a pledge where the money go: fundry, xwiki or stay in the account until feature completion 15:41 <@sdumitriu> But then I can pledge and retract it as I want 15:41 <@sdumitriu> They stay in the Fundry account 15:41 <+evalica> k thanks 15:41 <@sdumitriu> You can take it back later, but the PayPal transaction fees are lost 15:42  has joined #xwiki 15:42 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Don't start screaming! What do you think about making a longer 3.0 release? That is, one more milestone? 15:42 <+evalica> and when is XWiki receiving the money? when the creator of the feature task hit an approve or soemthing? 15:43 <@sdumitriu> I think so 15:43 <@sdumitriu> That's what I'm trying to find out 15:44  has quit 15:45 <@sdumitriu> Hm, if we get 11 more $, we'll be on the homepage 15:45  sdumitriu: ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh (mimicking a scream here) :) 15:45  one more milestone means 3 weeks more 15:46 <@sdumitriu> Yes 15:46 <@sdumitriu> :) 15:46  personally I don't mind but I don't feel it's good since we're do timeboxing. I prefer smaller releases and more releases than larger releases as a rule 15:47  also we'd need to get approval from everyone 15:47 <@sdumitriu> I know, but this is the best time to make major changes 15:47  you still have 1 week to make major changes 15:47 <@sdumitriu> I know 15:47  and then you can also major changes in 3.1 15:47  s/also/also make/ 15:48  what's the issue? 15:48  we could decide to reduce RCs 15:48  or remove them altogether if we're confident enough 15:48  (if that's the problem) 15:49  but I don't feel lengthening a release is a good soluion 15:49 <@sdumitriu> "Several more major  changes are planned for the next 3.0 milestones, like changing the  default theme, a new logo for the XWiki Open Source product, upgrading  all documents to the 2.0 (or 2.1) syntax, a new administration  interface, and many others." 15:49 <@sdumitriu> Problem is, we haven't progressed yet on most of these, and I'd like to have them in 3.0 15:49 <@sdumitriu> As Gregory said, 3.0 should bring in something different 15:49  I don't agree at all 15:49  that 3.x brgins something different I agree 15:50  but it doesn't have to be 3.0 15:50  not with our releae cycle rules 15:50  s/rules/strategy 15:50  what you are suggesting is completely opposed to timeboxing 15:50  ok let's take one by one 15:51  new default theme: not on the roadmap 15:51  new logo: not on the roadmap 15:51  has joined #xwiki 15:51  - upgrading all docs: not on the roadmap 15:51  new admin ui for vertical meun: on the roadmap but you said it was almost done for M1 15:52  many others would need to be listed 15:52  even if we don't have time for them I don't think lengthening the release is good 15:52  we need to review one by one 15:53 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: btw, what have we decided, do we keep the drop-down from Administer Wiki ? (the one used to jump to different admin sections) 15:53  sdumitriu: we could find a middle ground 15:54  and try to reduce the RCs timeframes 15:54  to keep our release dates 15:54  s/dates/date/ 15:54  (the final one I mean) 15:54 <+sburjan> IMO a logo would be a nice start for 3.x cycle 15:54  sburjan: sure go ahead 15:55  :) 15:55 <+sburjan> we have that huge list :) 15:55 <+sburjan> a lot of them are nice from that list 15:55 <@sdumitriu> I have to find the time to make the final proposal 15:55 <+sburjan> AFAIK there was a thread .. before I joined the community 15:55 <@sdumitriu> I know what it should look like, but there's little time for it 15:56 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: it needs more polishing ? 15:56 <@sdumitriu> Yes 15:56 <@sdumitriu> It should be a bit different 15:56 <@cjdelisle> Which one did the community end up voting on? 15:57 <@sdumitriu> This was the second round: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/LogoChallengeRound2 15:57 <@sdumitriu> The most voted was http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Community/LogoChallengeRound2/16-default-slanted.png 15:57 <@sdumitriu> But there were major vetos since it was unreadable 15:57 <@sdumitriu> So the next logo will use only the >^< x as a symbol 15:58 <@sdumitriu> And XWiki will be written cleanly 15:58 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm trying to implement XWIKI-5025 . Is it possible to run the macro transformations when using a StreamParser? i.e. is there a Listener that executes transformations? 15:58 <@sdumitriu> I have some nice ideas for animations, integrated in short videos about XWiki 15:59 <+sburjan> yes, this is the coolest :D 15:59 <@cjdelisle> Take the most highly voted and make it more readable sounds like a fair approch. 16:01 <@sdumitriu> Mmmm... Fruit.... http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Community/LogoChallengeRound2/16-fruit-slanted.png 16:03 <@sdumitriu> Btw, I've seen this logo (the X man) recently on Rexel commercials http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Community/LogoChallengeRound2/XWIKI.jpg 16:04  cu 16:04  has quit 16:05  mflorea: no, not possible easily 16:05  it would require a system with several passes, negating the streaming parsing btw 16:05 <+mflorea> yes, it's possible only for transformations that do "local" changes 16:05  some macros could work with a single pass 16:06  but several others won't 16:06 <+mflorea> yep 16:06 <@sdumitriu> For example the {{toc}} macro doesn't work 16:06  yes 16:06 <@sdumitriu> Plus, it will discard the priority settings 16:07 <+mflorea> this means I can use the StreamParser only for XHTML to wiki syntax 16:07  doxia has a toc macro for ex 16:07 <+mflorea> conversion 16:07  but it's less powerful than ours 16:07  (they do streaming) 16:10  lucaa: you forgot license header for the pom in xwiki-skin, adding it 16:10 <+lucaa> thanks 16:11  lucaa: can I remove     true 16:11   too? 16:11 <+lucaa> yes, I guess so 16:11 <+lucaa> we released M1 in the mean time, right? 16:11  that's what I'm asking 16:12  I'll test 16:12  lucaa: SkinExtension contains javadoc errors, I'll fix too 16:13 <+lucaa> ok, thanks 16:14  hmm no we cannot remove the CLIRR check, I'll add a comment 16:29 <@cjdelisle> Fun fact of the day: You can save() an object in hibernate and then modify it and as long as you don't commit or begin a new transaction in between, the modified version will be saved. 16:36  lucaa: missing svn ignores too… fixing that too ;) 16:36 <+lucaa> should I say thanks? 16:36 <+lucaa> thanks 16:37  nah 16:37  one thank is enough 16:37  ;) 16:37 <+lucaa> it's very strange that it's missing svn ignores.. 16:37 <+lucaa> and all that stuff that you say 16:37 <+lucaa> but anyway, I'll take your work 16:37 <+lucaa> word 16:37 <+lucaa> my svn is defective 16:41  has quit 17:00 <+mflorea> vmassol: the XHTML StreamParser doesn't work very well. I don't think I can use it, even for XHTML to xwiki/2.0 conversion. 17:01  mflorea: I don't know it too well (thomas coded it). What's wrong? Can you open a jira for hwat's not working? 17:01 <+mflorea> some content is lost during the conversion 17:01  that seems strange 17:02 <+mflorea> for instance \_\_test\_\_ ends up like \_\_\_\_ 17:04  it's strange since I thikn we're using the stream parser as the base for all our parsers 17:04 <+mflorea> hmm 17:05 <+mflorea> maybe it's the way I use it http://pastebin.com/mSN38Ecc 17:08  seems ok 17:09 <+mflorea> for instance, if I input: 17:09 <+mflorea> 

test

17:09 <+mflorea> I get 17:09 <+mflorea> \*\* 17:09 <+mflorea> in the printer, which is odd 17:10 <+mflorea> the actual input (html) is: 17:10 <+mflorea>  17:10 <+mflorea>  17:10 <+mflorea> 

test

17:10  what is your output syntax? 17:11 <+mflorea> xwiki/2.0 17:11  I need to finish something first, I can test after 17:12 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, thanks, I'll move to something else. ping me if you need more info 17:25  has quit 17:39  has quit 17:43  has joined #xwiki 17:56  has quit 17:57  has joined #xwiki 17:59  has quit 17:59  has joined #xwiki 18:10  has quit 18:46  has quit 18:57  has quit 19:16  has joined #xwiki 19:16  has quit 19:19  has quit 19:27  has joined #xwiki 19:27  has quit 19:37 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Published the activity report application 19:39  has joined #xwiki 19:43  has quit 19:49 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Should I understand you're close to finishing the store module? 19:58 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I'm not sure about the changes you've done on the XAIRCBOT fixed issues 19:59 <@sdumitriu> Why do they have fix-for 1.0 and affects again 1.0? 19:59 <@sdumitriu> Like XAIRCBOT-2 20:03 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: I created that patch 20:04 <+sburjan`> oh, you're talking about the JIRA issue 20:04 <+sburjan`> sorry 20:05  has joined #xwiki 20:11  has quit 20:23 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: I intend on moving in the attachment storage tomorrow. 20:24 <@cjdelisle> It is missing recyclebin store and I have one known bug in versioning sotre to tackle. 20:25 <@sdumitriu> Recyclebin is not that urgent 20:25 <@sdumitriu> It can be added later 20:25 <@cjdelisle> If we can disable the existing recyclebin then we will be able to attach arbitrary size files. 20:26 <@sdumitriu> Does it use streaming all the way from the client to the filesystem? 20:26 <@cjdelisle> yes 20:26 <@sdumitriu> Cool 20:26 <@sdumitriu> :) 20:28 <@cjdelisle> clinet -- stream ---> FileItem (temporary) --- (call to saveAttachmentContent) --- stream ---> persistant location. 20:28 <@cjdelisle> Actually stream to temp file, then 3 file switch. 20:28 <@cjdelisle> As you suggested. 20:28 <@cjdelisle> rename 20:29 <@cjdelisle> todo is move the locking code into it's own module. It's currently an inner class. 20:30 <@cjdelisle> +more tests 20:33 <@cjdelisle> bed time for me. any questions or code review just humiliate me on the list. 20:35 <@cjdelisle> Oh, bTransaction is not really supported because trying to support it would be horrible and would probably make the new code as bad if not worse than the old code. 20:36 <@cjdelisle> anyway, see ya tomorrow or late tonight 20:45  has joined #xwiki 21:43  has joined #xwiki 21:55  has quit 22:43  sdumitriu: because they shouldn't exist since the app had not been released 22:43  and with the new agreed strategy we ignore issues with affects == fix for in the release notes 22:44  i hesitated marking them all as "invalid" but I haven't…. your call 22:45  got to go, we can talk more about it tomorrow if you want 22:45  has quit
